translation.en: [woman on radio] Nautilus, Nautilus, Nautilus, what is your position?
Nautilus FPET one zero seven, what is your position?
All ships… All ships from the area of Copenhagen,
we are looking for a private submarine, Nautilus, black, and 18 meters long.
translation.ko: 18m 길이의 검은색 민간 잠수함 노틸러스호를 찾고 있으니

translation.en: Ships with any information, call Sea Rescue.
translation.ko: 정보를 입수한 선박은 해양 구조 협회로 연락 바랍니다

translation.en: [reporter] Latest news this morning,
a search is underway in the sea around Copenhagen
translation.ko: 코펜하겐 인근 해상에서 수색 작업이 한창입니다

translation.en: for a privately built submarine which went missing on Thursday night.
translation.ko: 목요일 밤에 자취를 감춘 민간 잠수함을 찾는 것이죠

translation.en: On board was a journalist and the owner of the submarine,
translation.ko: 기자 한 명과 동승한 잠수함 주인은

translation.en: Danish inventor Peter Madsen, best known for his rocket-building program,
translation.ko: 로켓 제작 계획으로 유명한 덴마크 발명가 페테르 마센입니다

translation.en: funded and manned by volunteers.
Apparently, Peter left on the submarine last night with a journalist.
translation.ko: 페테르가 어젯밤에 기자와 잠수함을 타고 나간 모양인데

translation.en: We're very worried.
So he didn't come.
[man 1] Yeah, so we're not sure what's going on.
For the record, the coastguard is also on that case.
[man 1] Yeah, it's not just us guys, no.
[man 2] There's still hope of finding them alive.
-[man 1] Okay. -There's air for 24 hours, maybe 30.
translation.ko: - 무사히 구조될 수도 있어요 - 맞아요 그 공기량이면 24~30시간은 버티겠죠

translation.en: -[woman] Who's the journalist? -[man 1] No.
I'm not sure who or what.
[man 1] It could make a big difference. I don't know.
translation.ko: 출발 시각에 따라 차이가 클 텐데

translation.en: [woman] Did he mention anything to you?
[man 1] No. I didn't know that he was sailing.
[woman] And we're sure it's a professional trip and not a date?
[man 1] Would sound like Peter's shenanigans, but apparently not.
translation.ko: 페테르가 음흉한 인간인 것처럼 말씀하시는데 그런 사람 아니에요

translation.en: [man 3] Oh, I just heard, somebody's seen the submarine laying next to Amager.
translation.ko: 잠수함이 아마게르섬 옆에 있는 걸 본 사람이 있다네요

translation.en: -[man 2] They find it? -No.
But they're sending a helicopter to check. Somebody saw something
translation.ko: 아직요, 헬기로 확인한답니다 스웨덴 가는 다리 옆에서 뭘 봤대요

translation.en: lying next to the bridge. The bridge to Sweden.
translation.ko: 스웨덴 가는 다리 옆에서 뭘 봤대요

translation.en: [man in Danish] There's something ahead. I've spotted it. Nautilus.
translation.ko: 전방에 뭔가 있어요 보입니다, 노틸러스호를 찾았어요

translation.en: -[man 3 in English] They found him! -[man 4] Where, what? Don't stop running--
translation.ko: 찾았대요! 네? 어디서요? 얼른 와서 얘기 좀 해봐요

translation.en: They're gonna be here in a few hours. They're on their way to Refshaleøen.
translation.ko: 레프스할레외엔으로 출발했으니 몇 시간 내로 올 거예요

translation.en: -So… -[woman vocalizing]
[man 1] We don't know a lot yet. We just heard that he's been found.
translation.ko: 아직 자세한 건 모르지만 페테르를 찾았답니다

translation.en: What a way to wake up. [chuckles]
[man 1] You get this picture in your mind of them being trapped under the water,
translation.ko: 겨우 몇 시간 남겨 두고 둘이 물속에 갇힌 모습이

translation.en: with few hours left.
It's a relief that he's okay.
[man 3] Two and a half hours.
Okay, two and a half hours until he's here.
[man 1] It sank.
[woman] Sorry, it's just 'cause I didn't hear it in English.
Someone… Someone's just posted this.
"We know from the rescue helicopter that the submarine sank… has sunk."
translation.ko: '잠수함이 가라앉았다는 소식을 구조 헬기를 통해 확인했다'

translation.en: "Peter was standing in the tower."
-[woman] So yeah, it did sink. -It did sink.
Let's just keep… Let's keep fact right now.
The only thing we know,
UC3 Nautilus has sunk, for whatever reason, we don't know why.
translation.ko: UC3 노틸러스호가 무슨 이유에선지 침몰한 겁니다

translation.en: And the only ones that know that is… is the journalist
translation.ko: 침몰 이유를 아는 사람은 배에 탄 기자와

translation.en: and Peter that's on board and we'll have to recap on that.
But they're both good. [sighs] They're both fine, which is…
-[engine turns over] -…the most important thing.
Okay, see you.
So, um, the problem is that, um,
the… the rescue vehicle only has Peter.
And apparently, the journalist was put onshore, uh, sometime last evening.
translation.ko: 듣자 하니 동승한 기자는 어제저녁 육지에 내려준 모양인데

translation.en: But her boyfriend and her family haven't heard from her.
[man 1] It's strange that no one knows about the passenger.
-[man 4] Yeah. -And if she was set ashore last night,
why didn't she contact her boyfriend and her parents?
translation.ko: 남자 친구와 부모님께 왜 연락하지 않았을까요?

translation.en: -Something in this story does not add up. -[man 5] I wonder where she is.
translation.ko: - 앞뒤가 안 맞아요 - 여자는 어디 있는 건지…

translation.en: [woman] Peter!
Are you okay?
[Peter in Danish] I'm fine. A bit sad.
-[reporter] You're sad? -Obviously.
Watching Nautilus sink was distressing.
translation.ko: 노틸러스가 가라앉는 걸 보니 가슴 아팠죠

translation.en: [in English] Oh, this right now? Live?
[in Danish] I was on a test run where I played around with some stuff.
translation.ko: 몇 가지를 수리하면서 시험 운행 중이었는데

translation.en: Then an error occurred on her ballast tank.
It wasn't that serious until I tried to repair it.
translation.ko: 심각한 수준이 아니라 직접 손보려고 했는데

translation.en: Then it became very serious.
It took 30 seconds for Nautilus to sink, and I couldn't close the hatches.
translation.ko: 30초 만에 배가 가라앉아서 해치를 닫지도 못했어요

translation.en: But that's okay. Otherwise, I'd still be down there.
[reporter] What about your passenger?
There was no one else but me on board.
[woman in English] Where's she? How come she hasn't shown up?
-[man 2] Who? -The journalist.
[man 6] I haven't heard anything. Only what Peter said.
[woman] Now he's with the police to get the story straight?
[man 6] Yeah. I really hope they find her.
translation.ko: 네, 기자를 꼭 찾아야 할 텐데

translation.en: [reporter] …off onshore. She is now missing.
Madsen meanwhile has been arrested and taken into police custody.
translation.ko: 한편 마센은 경찰에 체포되어 유치장에 구금되었습니다

translation.en: Okay, so I'm researching online
translation.ko: 자, 들어보세요 제가 온라인 조사를 하다가

translation.en: and I find a TED Talk by a guy called Peter Madsen.
translation.ko: 페테르 마센이라는 남자의 테드 강연 영상을 봤어요

translation.en: [Emma] He is a Danish celebrity who's built three submarines,
translation.ko: 그는 덴마크의 유명 인사로 잠수함 세 척을 제작한 인물이죠

translation.en: and his latest mission is to launch himself into space in a homemade rocket.
translation.ko: 최근에는 자체 제작 로켓 발사 계획을 준비 중이래요

translation.en: He's doing this with very little funding, just some donations,
translation.ko: 프로그램 운영 자금은 기부금과 강연 수익으로

translation.en: and money he gets from his lectures.
And incredibly, people from all around the world have come to Denmark to help him.
translation.ko: 놀랍게도 사람들은 세계 각지에서 그를 도우려고 덴마크로 모였어요

translation.en: So I write to him suggesting I make a documentary about his rocket quest,
translation.ko: 그래서 로켓 발사 계획에 관한 다큐를 찍고 싶다고 편지했더니

translation.en: and this is what he sends back.
"Emma. You are about to submerge into quite a snake pit."
translation.ko: '에마, 당신은 지금 뱀 구덩이에 들어오려는 거예요'

translation.en: "I am writing to you from the inside of a mechanical whale,
translation.ko: '저는 기계 고래 속에서 답장을 쓰고 있어요'

translation.en: the ballistic missile submarine Nautilus."
"Tonight she is my home, and being here makes me feel very safe."
translation.ko: '오늘 밤은 이곳이 제 보금자리죠 이 안에 있으면 마음이 놓여요'

translation.en: "But the lab, as we call RML here,
is much more than Nautilus."
"It is positively a crazy story of teamwork,
sky-high ambitions,
and the commitment and courage amongst the many people
who get into orbit around the space lab."
"All the best, Peter Madsen."
-[Peter] Yeah, okay. -[man] Yeah.
[Emma] Hey, how are you?
[Peter] This is a world premiere.
First time in the history of the space lab,
I can now reveal the Imperial Star Destroyer
that'll bring yours truly into the high stratosphere
translation.ko: 이 몸을 저 높은 성층권으로 보내줄 우주선이죠

translation.en: and beyond, and into space.
translation.ko: 성층권 너머 우주로 갈 수 있어요

translation.en: This is what we're doing.
This is our intercontinental ballistic missile, uh,
translation.ko: 저희는 지금 대륙 간 탄도 미사일을 탑재한

translation.en: passenger ship, under construction.
You see?
-Looks good. -It looks fucking marvelous.
[Emma] What's the ultimate mission of RML?
To make dreams come true.
-[both chuckle] -To play in an old derelict shipyard…
…and make every crazy concept into reality.
It's a wonderful piece of work here.
720 triangles,
and it's gonna be a space station.
But it's also the place where the interns and volunteers play.
None of these people are paid,
but they come here and they can be part of something enormous.`
translation.ko: 이곳에 와서 거대한 계획에 참여하고 있어요

translation.en: We're either gonna go into history as the greatest heroes
or the greatest criminals, and I'm gonna bet it's the criminals.
translation.ko: 끔찍한 범죄자로 남겠죠 범죄자일 확률이 높겠지만

translation.en: The purpose of this is to put a man in space.
So we are going to launch three rockets in the Baltic Ocean
during the summer of 2017.
So it's not a dream for much longer.
No, no, no. Sit down.
Yeah, sitting down. I'm calm. Are you calm?
I'm not. [chuckles]
Everybody, this is flights.
We can confirm we've got flameouts and area is safe and open.
translation.ko: 엔진이 갑자기 정지되어 안전한 공터에 착륙했습니다

translation.en: -[Peter chats indistinctly] -Good.
Perfect. Hey, oi.
-Fist bump. -[chuckles]
No, no, no. No, no, no, no.
[Christoffer] For many years, I had on my bucket list that I would really love
translation.ko: 수년 전부터 죽기 전에 하고 싶은 일 중 하나가

translation.en: to go diving with a submarine.
translation.ko: 수년 전부터 죽기 전에 하고 싶은 일 중 하나가 잠수함에 타는 거였죠

translation.en: For my Christmas present from my wife, I actually got an opportunity
translation.ko: 아내가 크리스마스 선물로 그 기회를 만들어 줬어요

translation.en: to go diving with Peter's submarine.
I found someone who shares the same passion
for science and engineering.
translation.ko: 같은 꿈을 꾸는 사람과 만난 거예요

translation.en: I… I think you could say that in 2007,
our relationship, and… and the beginning of our friendship really kicked off.
translation.ko: 친구가 됐을 거예요 그때부터 친분이 생겼죠

translation.en: It's… It's been more than ten years.
We keep going back to the point that if we have a core of people
translation.ko: 같은 지점으로 자꾸 돌아오잖아 핵심 인력을 모아서

translation.en: then we can build a team that can make this happen.
translation.ko: 팀을 꾸려 대응하도록 하자 그러면 거뜬히 성공할 수 있어

translation.en: [woman] In the beginning, I would look outside my window
and it would just look like this lab,
like, equipment everywhere and it was like, "What is this?"
translation.ko: 장비가 여기저기 널려 있어서 대체 뭘까 싶었죠

translation.en: And he was like, "Oh, this is a space lab."
And it was just like, my jaw dropped immediately.
translation.ko: 그 말을 듣자마자 입이 떡 벌어졌죠

translation.en: I was just like, "A space lab?"
Space rockets?
Are you frickin' kidding me?
I need to be a part of what you're doing.
translation.ko: 나도 당신들 일에 무조건 끼워 달라고 했어요

translation.en: [in Danish] We are making history.
[in English] One thing there is with Peter is that he's definitely the most…
translation.ko: 한 가지 확실한 건 페테르만큼 대단한 사람은…

translation.en: [in Danish] And this is Peter, Peter Madsen.
[in English] …epic person you've ever met.
He's an artist.
He has a personality like an artist.
He's always saying, "You're kind of like me,
going with the wind, being impulsive."
That's why we click so good together,
because we understand each other's emotions and each other's passions,
translation.ko: 서로의 감정 상태와 열정을 잘 이해하니까요

translation.en: and he knows how to pick me up from where I just feel
translation.ko: 저를 수렁에서 건져 낼 줄 알죠 쓸모없는 인간이라는 생각에 빠졌을 때요

translation.en: like I'm worth nothing.
And he knows how to tell me I'm great as I am.
translation.ko: 지금 이대로도 훌륭하다고 다독여 줄 줄 알아요

translation.en: [Peter] Let's get ready for our briefing.
What we're gonna do today is to expose our astronaut pilot to high acceleration.
translation.ko: 오늘 우주 비행사가 초가속 상태를 경험하게 할 계획입니다

translation.en: We do that by spinning him around in this centrifuge that we built outside.
translation.ko: 옥외에 제작한 원심기에 매달아서 돌리는 거죠

translation.en: [man] The reason I applied for an internship was because of Peter.
translation.ko: 저는 페테르 때문에 이 인턴십에 지원했어요

translation.en: Because he seems like something special
and… and he seems like he was different, and I always wanted to meet him.
translation.ko: 남들과 달라 보였어요 페테르를 늘 만나고 싶었죠

translation.en: He had awesome videos on YouTube and he was on television.
translation.ko: 유튜브와 TV 출연 영상을 보니 참 멋지더라고요

translation.en: [Peter] They say that you're crazy, you're going to die.
But they're also gonna die ultimately and not gonna have all the fun
translation.ko: 사람은 결국 다 죽어요 이렇게 재밌는 일을 안 하고 살아도요

translation.en: to do this sort of thing.
translation.ko: 이렇게 재밌는 일을 안 하고 살아도요

translation.en: [Stefan] And I thought I really would like to be like this guy.
translation.ko: 나도 이 사람처럼 되고 싶다고 생각했죠

translation.en: Have you been inside the submarine yet? It's quite nice.
translation.ko: 잠수함 들어가 본 적 없어요? 정말 근사해요

translation.en: Peter has this idea how things, um, could work.
translation.ko: 페테르는 어떻게 하면 성공할지 계획이 다 서 있어요

translation.en: It's a mixture between, I don't know, craziness
translation.ko: 광기 어린 열정에 새로운 시도가 더해져

translation.en: and doing something completely new.
Radio check, sector one.
-[man 1 on radio] Sector one, clear. -Sector two?
Sector two, clear.
[Emma] Would you jump in it? Jump in the rocket?
Holy Christ, this is really happening.
That is why I'm here.
-[on radio] …six… -[chuckles]
…five, four, three, two, one.
Friends, it's fine!
A-okay, yoo-hoo! This is great!
-It's a great, great, great day. -I told you we was gonna see you again.
translation.ko: 성공적인 하루였어요 살아서 다시 볼 거라고 했죠?

translation.en: -You're good at math, young man. -Thank you.
Everybody says, "Yes!"
-[scattered] Yes! Woo! -Yeah!
-[indistinct chatter] -Yes!
We don't have any facts.
-We don't. -We don't.
And the only… the only thing we know is that Peter is safe.
translation.ko: 저희가 아는 정보라고는 페테르가 안전하다는 것뿐이죠

translation.en: We have no information on the second passenger.
[reporter in Danish] Of course, we want to know who was on board with him.
A Swedish journalist?
I don't know, um…
There's nothing odd about us having people, journalists, on board.
translation.ko: 기자들이 같이 탔다고 해서 이상할 건 전혀 없지만요

translation.en: The terrible thing about it
is that the journalist hasn't yet been found.
translation.ko: 그 기자가 아직도 발견되지 않았다는 사실이죠

translation.en: That's absolutely devastating.
The way I know Peter Madsen, and the way he always acts,
translation.ko: 제가 아는 페테르는 이렇게 행동했을 사람이거든요

translation.en: if she was on board when the submarine sank,
I can guarantee that he would have helped her out first.
translation.ko: 분명 그 기자부터 먼저 탈출시켰을 거예요

translation.en: There are indications that he dropped her off last night
translation.ko: 어젯밤에 페테르가 기자를 내려줬다는 말이 있어요

translation.en: in Copenhagen, and then went out on his own.
translation.ko: 코펜하겐 항구에요 그 후 혼자 바다에 나간 거죠

translation.en: Nobody knows where she is, and that's terrible.
translation.ko: 기자의 행방을 아무도 모른다니 마음이 정말 안 좋아요

translation.en: She has a family and a boyfriend who don't know where she is,
translation.ko: 가족과 남자 친구도 기자가 어디에 있는지 모른대요

translation.en: and they must be absolutely devastated.
translation.ko: 지금 그분들 속은 썩어 문드러질 거예요

translation.en: [in English] Yeah, but maybe she was just delivered to a destination
translation.ko: 어쩌면 페테르가 기자를 목적지에 내려줬을 수 있어요

translation.en: and… and then Peter left or wanted to go back
translation.ko: 그러고 나서 페테르 혼자 돌아온 거라

translation.en: and she didn't know about it, maybe.
-I'm a bit curious about that theory line. -[indistinct chatter]
[Emma] The latest news.
[reporter in Danish] Peter Madsen has been charged with killing a Swedish journalist.
translation.ko: 페테르 마센은 스웨덴 기자를 살해한 혐의로 기소되었습니다

translation.en: The Swedish woman's boyfriend sounded the alarm when she didn't return.
translation.ko: 여기자가 돌아오지 않자 그의 남자 친구가 주의를 촉구했죠

translation.en: He says that he dropped her off on Refshaleøen.
translation.ko: 페테르 마센은 레프스할레외엔에 기자를 내려줬다고 합니다

translation.en: [Emma in English] Hang on. He's been charged with killing her?
What was that?
Peter… Peter says that he-- this Swedish woman journalist,
translation.ko: 페테르 말로는 어젯밤에 이 스웨덴 여성 기자를

translation.en: that he set her ashore on Refshaleøen last night.
[Stefan] Okay.
Which, like, it wouldn't make sense that she wouldn't contact her boyfriend?
translation.ko: 그럼 남자 친구한테 연락 없는 게 이상하잖아요

translation.en: Of all the people, that's the only one who says she was put ashore.
translation.ko: 기자가 육지에 내렸다고 말하는 사람은 페테르뿐이에요

translation.en: -[Emma] Yeah. -Yeah.
[man] Yeah, so it's definitely suspicious.
[Sara] Yeah.
[reporter 1] Police continue their search for the missing journalist
translation.ko: 실종 기자 수색 작업이 한창인 덴마크 경찰은

translation.en: and ask if you have any information, to contact Danish police.

translation.en: [reporter 2] Kim Wall's work has been published internationally

-[Emma] Yeah, what was that? -[overlapping responses]

translation.en: Yeah. Is it called a hacksaw?
-Um, with an orange handle and-- -[man 2] Hacksaw or wood saw?
translation.ko: - 주황색 손잡이 달린… - 목공용 톱 아니고요?

translation.en: -Wood saw, I think. -[man 2] Okay.
[Emma] Why would you bring a wood saw onto a steel submarine?
translation.ko: 강철 잠수함에 왜 목공용 톱을 가져가죠?

translation.en: [man 1] Exactly. It doesn't make sense at all.
[Emma] Did they ask you about the women in the workshop or anything like that?
Oh, they asked that actually, if I've seen her,
Kim Wall, in the workshop, and I haven't.
translation.ko: 킴 발을 봤냐길래 못 봤다고 했죠

translation.en: Um, and if I've heard Peter talked about her and I haven't.
translation.ko: 페테르가 언급한 적 있냐길래 역시 없다고 했어요

translation.en: I didn't even know of her before the next day.
But I mean, if he planned this,
then he were maybe just planning the next person or the next woman.
translation.ko: 페테르는 단순히 여성 표적이 걸려들길 기다린 걸 수 있어요

translation.en: "Who I have alone in the submarine
when I get the chance to do this, I'm gonna do it."
So the police might not find a specific reason for it being her.
translation.ko: 그렇다면 킴 발이 당한 이유는 경찰이 못 알아낼지 몰라요

translation.en: It could just be that she was the first opportunity he had.
[Emma] He talked to me that week about if I got in the submarine with him.
translation.ko: 그 주에 페테르는 저한테 잠수함에 같이 타겠냐고 물었어요

translation.en: [Emma] He didn't invite men on to that submarine,

And wasn't it that he sent you a message on the 10th saying,
"Let's go out on the submarine tomorrow"?
[Sara] Yeah.
He just said that, "Nautilus is sailing so beautifully,

It was Kim who was insisting on doing it that night.
translation.ko: 애초에 그날 밤에 나가자고 한 사람은 킴이었어요

translation.en: So she just went on.
[Emma] You have two interns injured.
One burned, one with a sprain or something.
translation.ko: 하나는 화상 입고 하나는 어딜 삐었다던데

translation.en: [Peter] Burnt feet, broken legs, lacerations,
translation.ko: 발을 데고 다리가 부러지고 피부가 찢어졌죠

translation.en: a sick cat, a truck driver that's too busy.
translation.ko: 고양이는 아프고 트럭 운전사는 너무 바빠요

translation.en: Christmas is cancelled. Winter is coming.
And I'm going to kill someone with a spoon.
I will select the person to be killed by chance.
[in Danish] Betrayal.
Now when you're a grown-up, you must get used to a new phenomenon: 'Betrayal'.
translation.ko: 어른이 되면 '배신'이라는 새로운 현상에 적응해야만 해요

translation.en: You will be betrayed. You will be trampled on and forced down.
translation.ko: 누군가 당신을 배신하고 짓밟고 집어삼킬 거예요

translation.en: [woman] I get my driver's license on the tenth.
-That's great. -Yeah.
-[Emma in English] You talking about me? -Yeah, we're talking about you.
translation.ko: - 내 얘기 해요? - 네, 에마 얘기예요

translation.en: Yeah.
-We're gonna hack you to death. -[gasps]
[Emma] That's a bit rough.
No, hugging you is-- That's a--
-You said 'hug'? -Hug?
That's so much nicer than hack.
-[Emma chuckles] -We're not gonna hack you to death.
You… You heard me saying hack, but I did say hug.
translation.ko: 에마가 잘못 들은 거죠 난 '포옹'한다고 했어요

translation.en: -[Emma] Yeah. -And we don't use hammers for hugging.
translation.ko: - 그렇군요 - 우린 포옹할 때 망치 안 써요

translation.en: That would be a little bit rude.
You'll be pressed towards the soft belly skin of a cat.
With no escape possible.
You just have to enjoy it.
You're not filming me cooking in the workshop, are you?
translation.ko: 작업실에서 요리하는 내 모습을 찍는 건 아니죠?

translation.en: -[Emma] Yeah. -I know you are.
It's not going into the movie.
[Emma] No.
[Peter] It's not going into the-- I know you want it. I know.
translation.ko: 넣으면 안 돼요 에마는 넣고 싶겠지만요

translation.en: Course you are, it's a perfect shot.
[Peter] Today, uh, is the day when we try a sort of simulated launch operation.
translation.ko: 왔군요 발사 작전 시뮬레이션을 가동해 보는 날이에요

translation.en: We wanna tow the platform and see we can have it under control with the submarine.
I'm very excited about how this whole thing is gonna work out.
Stefan, can you take a line from the, uh, new platform?
-[Stefan] Yeah, yeah. -Cool.
[Stefan] Oh, those amateurs.
-[Emma] Is there a plan here? -No, never. Have you ever seen a plan?
translation.ko: 계획은 세운 건가요? 아뇨, 그럴 리가요 계획 세운 거 본 적 있어요?

translation.en: You can just give the rope to me, because I can pull it taut… taut to me.
translation.ko: 나한테 줄을 줘요 여기서 팽팽하게 당길 테니까 말만 해요

translation.en: [man] Yeah, but we're scraping the quayside.
translation.ko: - 위로요? 아니면 여기? - 부두에 안 긁히게 해요

translation.en: [Stefan] Oh, fuck me.
The nut down there is completely loose.
-[Emma] Are you kidding me? -Yeah.
[Emma] So all the bolts are rattling loose?
I mean, I think he needs to take it out tomorrow otherwise it will fall apart.
translation.ko: 내일 뽑아야 할 것 같아요 다 허물어지기 전에요

translation.en: -[Emma] Really? -Yeah, yeah.
I don't even know if we can afford to launch this year.
translation.ko: 올해 발사할 여력이 될지도 잘 모르겠네요

translation.en: -[Peter in Danish] Thanks. Great sailing. -At least we didn't put any dents in it.
translation.ko: - 고맙습니다, 운전 잘하셨어요 - 찌그러진 데는 없으니까요

translation.en: It was amazing.
Did you identify the error?
Not interested. -A technician can take a look. -[indistinct response]
translation.ko: 전 상관 안 해요 기술자가 보면 되니까

translation.en: We're doing some TV.
It'll only take 30 seconds.
[in English] Rolling.
Whoa, we're back ashore now,
and everything we tried went well.
We have been, uh, towing the platform,
we've been tilting it up to almost ten degrees, I think.
It was like going-- It was literally the Titanic going down.
It worked very well.
And, um, we've been towing the platform first with the electric motor.
translation.ko: 먼저 발사대를 끌어와서 전기 모터에 연결했습니다

translation.en: We now know that we can do 1.7 knots like that,
which is beautiful for the launch.
[Emma] So there were no hiccups or anything along the way--
as… as soon as you went--
translation.ko: 그럼 시뮬레이션 과정에서 문제는 없었나요? 일정 맞추기가…

translation.en: That-- No, that worked perfectly. She's just in an excellent mood.
translation.ko: 모든 면에서 완벽했어요 노틸러스호 상태는 최상이에요

translation.en: [Emma] Because in seven or eight days, we're taking her out to Bornholm
to prepare for the rocket launch.
Well, according to– I don't know what date it is today,
but I know that on the 11th we're going to Bornholm.
So there's, um, a lot of tension on that.
We'll see how that works out.
I guess I'll be in despair in the beginning of the day, then it'll get better, and I'll be happy.
translation.ko: 그날 자포자기 심정으로 갔다가 만족하며 돌아올 것 같은데요

translation.en: [Stefan] Talking to Peter, like, it felt like,
wow, you… you really can trust this guy.
But in reality, you learned over time that he's actually a great liar.
translation.ko: 하지만 실제로 곁에서 지켜보면 희대의 사기꾼인 걸 알게 돼요

translation.en: There are many people out there with lots of money that believe him.
translation.ko: 부자들 중에 페테르를 신뢰하는 사람 많아요

translation.en: Initially, he… he even said he was gonna launch three rockets this year.
translation.ko: 처음에 페테르는 올해 로켓 3기를 발사할 거라고 했어요

translation.en: So now he only have maybe… maybe only one, yeah.
translation.ko: 그런데 지금은 겨우 하나 발사할까 말까 하죠

translation.en: [Emma] But the big news now is that Peter and CS have chosen the same place
translation.ko: 그래도 지금 페테르와 CS의 이야기가 화제잖아요 같은 시각, 같은 장소에서 로켓을 발사한다고 해서요

translation.en: and time to launch both their separate rockets.
translation.ko: 같은 시각, 같은 장소에서 로켓을 발사한다고 해서요

translation.en: So the Copenhagen space race has now reached fever pitch.
translation.ko: 코펜하겐 우주 개발 경쟁이 극에 달한 상황이죠

translation.en: I mean, he has not much resources left,
translation.ko: 페테르는 현재 남은 자원이 많지 않아요

translation.en: so he has not many ways to go right now.
translation.ko: 그래서 앞으로 선택지가 많지 않은 실정이죠

translation.en: [reporter] Authorities have been unable to locate the cell phones
translation.ko: 당국은 킴 발과 페테르 마센의 휴대 전화를

translation.en: of either Kim Wall or Peter Madsen,
and the police are working to access the computer
that was found in Madsen's workshop.
[Emma] You had a strange encounter with Peter the day before Kim Wall was killed.
translation.ko: 킴 발이 살해되기 전날 페테르와 만났을 때 이상했다고요?

translation.en: [Stefan] That was a weird situation.
We were just talking about something,
and then suddenly, he said about a website.
translation.ko: 뜬금없이 페테르가 웹 사이트 얘기를 하더라고요

translation.en: It's like a website, where you can see about victims from murder scenes,
translation.ko: 살해 현장의 피해자를 볼 수 있는 웹 사이트 같은 거요

translation.en: how they look like after.
Um, such, uh, things.
Um, and he was talking about it and he asked me if I know the website.
translation.ko: 페테르가 저한테 그런 사이트를 아는지 묻길래

translation.en: I just said, "Okay, what the heck are you talking about?"
And that was just out of nowhere, he just said that and, um…
translation.ko: 정말 아무 맥락 없이 불쑥 그런 얘기를 꺼냈으니까요

translation.en: Well, sometimes, um, he was talking about…
translation.ko: 뭐, 가끔가다 페테르가 이런 말을 하긴 했어요

translation.en: Well, in the past, like, he always talks about, "Oh, machine guns and cannons,"
translation.ko: 예전에 자주 하던 말인데 기관총이랑 대포를 가져다가

translation.en: and, "Oh, we wanna shoot two people and blah, blah,"
but it was more in a funny way
and not like that he wanna see somebody, um…
translation.ko: 실제로 죽는 사람을 보고 싶다는 말은 아니었죠

translation.en: like, dying in front of him.
translation.ko: 눈앞에서 누가 죽는 모습 말이에요 "페테르 마센의 컴퓨터에서 페티시, 고문, 살해 영상 발견"

translation.en: [Stefan] But, um, the police have found such evidence on his hard drive.
translation.ko: 근데 페테르의 하드 드라이브에서 경찰이 그런 증거를 찾아냈잖아요

translation.en: That's something what I have not expected from him.
That's something that surprised me, I must say that.
translation.ko: 그래서 그 얘기를 듣고 깜짝 놀랐죠

translation.en: [reporter] Danish prosecutors have revealed, uh, new details
translation.ko: 킴 발 스웨덴 기자 살인 사건과 관련하여

translation.en: on the murder of Swedish journalist Kim Wall.
Videos of the torture and murder of women on Madsen's computer.
translation.ko: 마센의 컴퓨터에는 여성 고문 및 살해 영상이 있었죠

translation.en: [reporter 2] A hard drive was seized in his workshop with fetish films
translation.ko: 마센의 작업실에서 입수한 하드 드라이브에서 발견된 것은

translation.en: showing women being tortured, decapitated, and even burned alive.
translation.ko: 여성을 고문, 참수하고 산 채로 불태우는 페티시 영화였죠

translation.en: The engineer says, the drive wasn't his.
[investigator in Danish] Good morning. We'd like to give you an update
translation.ko: 안녕하십니까 '잠수함 사건' 수사에 관해 새로운 정보를 전해드리려 합니다

translation.en: on the "submarine case" investigation.
translation.ko: '잠수함 사건' 수사에 관해 새로운 정보를 전해드리려 합니다

translation.en: We've conducted multiple dives on Thursday and Friday in Køge Bay.
translation.ko: 저희는 목요일과 금요일 코이에북트만에 수차례 잠수부를 투입하여 수사했습니다

translation.en: Yesterday morning, we first found a bag
translation.ko: 그 결과, 어제 아침 제일 먼저 가방 하나를 찾았습니다

translation.en: in which we found Kim Wall's clothes,
a shirt, a skirt, socks, and shoes.
translation.ko: 셔츠, 스커트, 양말, 신발이 들어 있었습니다

translation.en: There was also a knife and lead weights to weigh the bag down.
translation.ko: 가방을 가라앉히기 위한 납덩이와 칼 한 자루도 있었죠

translation.en: Around midday, we found one leg and then another leg.
translation.ko: 정오쯤 저희는 다리 두 쪽을 연달아 발견했습니다

translation.en: Shortly thereafter, we found a head lying in a bag
translation.ko: 그리고 얼마 지나지 않아 가방에 든 머리도 찾았습니다

translation.en: that was weighed down with several pieces of metal.
translation.ko: 가방은 금속 덩어리 때문에 가라앉아 있었죠

translation.en: There's no sign of fracture to the skull
translation.ko: 두개골에는 골절 흔적도 없었을 뿐만 아니라

translation.en: and no sign of any other blunt trauma to the skull.
translation.ko: 뭉툭한 대상에 부딪혀 생긴 외상의 흔적도 없었습니다

translation.en: [in English] They found the head, and the legs,
and the head had no, uh, physical damage,
um, from the hatch.
Because, like, Peter was talking, saying that the hatch was hitting her head
translation.ko: 기자가 해치에 머리를 부딪혔다고 페테르는 진술했잖아요

translation.en: and then she had an open skull, or something like that.
But, um, yeah, that was not the case when they found the head.
translation.ko: 근데 기자의 두개골을 확인하니 사실이 아니었죠

translation.en: So, um, that means that Peter lied again.
[reporter 1] Madsen changed his story again.
[reporter 2] Madsen now says she suffered carbon monoxide poisoning.
[reporter 3] …carbon monoxide poisoning.
He admits however, to dismembering her body and throwing it overboard.
translation.ko: 한편 마센은 시신의 팔다리를 잘라 바다에 버린 것은 시인했습니다

translation.en: [reporter 4] Investigators believe this was a sadistic sex crime.
translation.ko: 수사관은 본 사건을 가학성 성범죄로 여깁니다

translation.en: He tied Wall up and tortured her before killing her.
translation.ko: 마센이 피해자를 묶어 고문한 후 살해했기 때문이죠

translation.en: They also believe it was premeditated.
[Sara] I feel like the ghost of Kim is angry at me
translation.ko: 킴의 유령이 저한테 화를 내는 것 같아요

translation.en: and she's hating me for being friends with Peter.
translation.ko: 페테르와 가까이 지낸 제가 미울 거예요

translation.en: And how dare I be friends with a monster like that
translation.ko: 어떻게 그런 괴물과 친하게 지낼 수 있을까요?

translation.en: without even warning the world about it.
I'm so naive.
[Emma] Why?
[Sara] I don't know, I think I was being manipulated by him.
translation.ko: 모르겠어요, 그 사람한테 조종당했던 것 같아요

translation.en: And it's more and more obvious
that it was maybe supposed to be me on the sub.
translation.ko: 잠수함에 태우려던 사람이 저였을 수도 있는 거잖아요

translation.en: I was supposed to ride the submarine with him the next day.
translation.ko: 그다음 날, 저는 페테르와 잠수함에 타기로 돼 있었어요

translation.en: [Emma] If you'd gone on the submarine with him, would you have felt safe?
Yeah. Of course.
[Emma] Why?
Because it's my friend.
[Emma] Space lab is quiet.
Looks like nobody showed up.
So I guess today RML might be a one-man space program?
translation.ko: 오늘 RML에서 추진하는 건 1인 우주 계획인가요?

translation.en: [Peter] It's not supposed to be that.
I need people to be around in order to get things done.
translation.ko: 사람들이 와야 작업을 끝낼 수 있는데

translation.en: But there's nobody here.
It's a tragic, stupid,
absurd, counterintuitive, crazy thing.
People came to this island to help Peter build his rocket and go to space.
translation.ko: 페테르가 로켓을 만들어 우주에 나가도록 도우러 와 놓고

translation.en: So what are they doing? Are they helping?
translation.ko: 다들 뭐 하는 거죠? 이게 돕는 거예요?

translation.en: What's the fucking point?
[Stefan] I think he always wanted to be a dictator or somehow.
translation.ko: 페테르는 늘 독재자처럼 굴고 싶어 했죠

translation.en: And he wanted to control people.
But the interns, they left.
And I got de-motivated.
He couldn't keep people together, he couldn't control them
because he had no power to do that.
And how can you have the most power?
Cause… pain to somebody.
I have a saying.
In all of your life's most important moments,
you're all alone.
You are all alone when you get born, and you're all alone when you die.
translation.ko: 사람은 태어날 때도 혼자고 죽을 때도 혼자 죽어요

translation.en: You're all alone at the end of the day
in the most important moments in your life.
[reporter 1] News coming from Copenhagen.
The Danish man accused of murdering a female journalist
translation.ko: 자신이 만든 잠수함에서 여성 기자를 살해한 혐의로

translation.en: aboard his homemade submarine is on trial in the city.
translation.ko: 기소된 덴마크 남성이 코펜하겐에서 재판대에 오릅니다

translation.en: [reporter 2] Danish prosecutors are seeking a life sentence for inventor, Peter Madsen.
translation.ko: 덴마크 검찰은 페테르 마센에게 종신형을 구형할 예정입니다

translation.en: ..and his lawyers have focused on the fact that there is no forensic evidence
translation.ko: 변호인은 마센의 주장을 반증할 법의학 증거가 없다는 점을

translation.en: to disprove his version of events.
[reporter 3] Madsen pleading not guilty…
[reporter 4] They were arguing for a six-month sentence of dismembering a body.
translation.ko: 사지 절단 행위에 대한 6개월 형이 타당하다고 주장했죠

translation.en: [reporter 5] The indictment charges Madsen with premeditated murder,
translation.ko: 기소장에 따르면 마센은 계획 살인 혐의와

translation.en: and indecent handling of a corpse,
as well as sexual relations
other than intercourse of a particularly dangerous nature.
That legal language obscures the brutality of the alleged crime.
translation.ko: 이러한 법률 용어 때문에 범죄의 잔혹성은 잘 드러나지 않죠

translation.en: [reporter 6] The problem is that there were only two people aboard the submarine,
translation.ko: 문제는, 잠수함에 탄 사람이 그 두 사람뿐이었다는 겁니다

translation.en: and only they know what happened inside.
translation.ko: 잠수함 안에서 일어난 일은 그들만 안다는 거죠

translation.en: [reporter 7] What really happened?

that it's gonna work out for me and for the people here.

that's two different people.
Very different people.

one, zero.

that psychopaths exist amongst us.
Human predators that walk around and grabs people,

translation.en: and use them, throw them out, used, and maybe stalk them afterwards and so on.

And psychopathic people are often very charismatic,
translation.ko: 반사회적 인격 장애자 즉, 사이코패스는 대개 카리스마가 넘치고

And he will try really to punish those people who have been under his spell,

by talking badly about them, all these things.
There is the possibility that you've simply come upon a human predator.

Because do the psychopath know that he's a psychopath?
